text.p:
PRINTED FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF ABERDEEN
BY R . CARRUTHERS & SONS
INVERNESS
MCMXXXVII

Fàilt ort , a charaid mo rùin ! 405
Aoidhe ’ n fhir o ’ n lium mo bhith :
Biodhmaide ri chéile blàth
O ’ s dual duinn a ’ bhàidh nach brisd .
B ’ aoidhe Bellerophon caoin
An dùn Oeneuis laoch nam fear , 410
Fichead là gun ghruaim ’ sa ’ chùirt
Chath iad a ’ chuilm mhùirneach mhear .
Le h - iomlaid naisg iad an gràdh
Seudan àluinn bu daor luach
Bhuilich Oeneus mìn - chrios arm 415
Cho dearg ris a ’ chorcar nuadh .
Bhuilich do sheanair cuach òir
Fathast tha ’ m ball còrr am ’ theach :
A thaobh mo deagh - athar féin
Chaidh cruth an tréin as mo bheachd . 420
Dh ’ fhàg e mi ’ m phàisd air a ’ chìch
’ Nuair sheòl e o ’ n tìr le ’ shluagh
’ S a thuit iad romh ’ n am ’ sa ’ bhlàr
Aig dùn Thebè nan àrd stuagh .
’ Bhrìgh sin , air do theachd ’ san Ghréig 425
Gheibh thu ’ n Argos féisd a ghaoil :
< ’ S air teachd dhomh gu> Licia nunn
chùirt bidh mo dhùil ri faoilt .
Sgriosam - sa feachd Thròidh nan cliar
’ Fhad ’ s ’ a chòngnas dia le m ’ chruaidh ; 430
Lean thus ’ air a ’ Ghréig gu garg
’ S na thàras tu marbh is ruaig .
Ach sinne le dùrrachd bàis
A chéile gu bràth cha bhuail :
’ S nochdaidh ar malairt do chàch 435
Gur dùchas duinn càirdeas buan .

The text of this translation into Gaelic of Books i - vi with part of vii of the Iliad of Homer is taken from two MS . volumes in Ewen Maclachlan ’ s handwriting . One of these containing the translation of Books i - iv has the following on its title - page : —
|
An t - ILIAD | ’ s e sin , | TEANNACHADH NA TROIDHE : | Sgeulachd a rinn HOMER | An t - ARD - FHILIDH GREUGACH , | ’ An CEITHIR DUANAIBH FICHEAD . | A nis ’ air a tionndadh bho ’ n Ghréigis | gu Gàëlig Albannaich , | Le h - Eóbhon Mac - Lach ’ ainn an Gàidheal | Abrach . | ( Quot ) ’ S taitneach sgeul air am a dh ’ fhalbh . Oisiann . | ’ An OBAIR - READHAIN | ’ S a bhliadhna 1816 .
( MS . A . )

The other has as title - page : — An t - ILIAD : | ’ se sin | URSGEUL MU CHOGADH | NA GREIGE ’ S NA TROIDHE . | SEANN - DAN GREUGAIS , | A RINN HOMER , AM FILI | IOMRAITEACH . | ON GHREUGAIS GU GAELIG , | Le h - Eobhon Mac Lachainn | An t - Abrach . | EARRANN 11 . | An Sean ’ bhaile Obair - Readhain | Sa bhliadhna 1811 .
( MS . B . )

MS . A is clearly a fair copy written out by the author in the way in which he intended it to be printed . Only a few changes have been made from it in spellings and diacritic marks , and no spelling that might be of interest is changed . MS . B is not so clear , as it has erasures and corrections , and the spellings of words differ at times from that in the later MS . No attempt has been made here to standardise the spelling all through . The author himself was not consistent . Occasionally such a spelling as déidh for deigh , clì for clìth , cròc for cròchd , chaoidh for choidhch ’
is adopted . MacLachan often writes crìdh ,
metri gratia , so as to keep his line to seven syllables , but such a form does not exist in Scottish Gaelic . The normal cridhe is here given , despite its two syllables , as more innocuous than a non - existent crìdh .
In the same way MacLachlan has the two forms fàidh and fàidhe ,
the former when the metre demands a single syllable , the latter when a dissyllable is required . The H . S . D . gives both forms , but it may be questioned if the form fàidhe ever existed . The diphthong ài splits into ā + i in Scottish Gaelic , giving what is really a dissyllable ; fàidhe may be an attempt to represent that . The same happens with òi in such a word as dòigh ,
which is pronounced do : i .

Examples are : — thàines ( iv . 395 ) , and ràineas ( iii . 361 ) as i sg . preterite ; ràineas ( i . 573 ) seems to be passive autonomous . So sheasamh occurs four times as a preterite in the later part of his translation ; sheas is the form he uses in the earlier . At v . 634 there is the form mairfidh ,
though he seems to have first written mairidh .
There are several instances of forms like fhuaradar ( i . 577 ) , maomadar ( iv . 959 ) , etc . He sometimes adopts spellings like bruchdadh muid , dh ’ ìobradh mid .
Forms of the 1st sg . present or future in - im or - am are common , e . g . theirim ( i . 373 ) , bheiream ( i . 25 ) . There are , too , some instances of the negative ní , nì n ’ éirgheam ( i . 523 ) , nì m ’ facas ( ii , 1495 ) . Ti bhur beath ’ agus ceud fàilt !
appears in An Gaidheal as
’ S e ur beath ’ mòr ( i . 523 ) .

As to the noun forms , there are only a few plurals in a vowel ending e . g . teumanna l . 508 , clocha ( Dain p . 219 ln . 121 ) , aoidhe ( vi . 315 ) . Some other plural forms and spellings may be mentioned — oibrean ( Dàin p . 208 ln . 42 ) guithean ( vi . 96 ) , roithean ( v . 1358 ) , gaithibh ( iii . 267 ) . In the plural the ending - ibh is constantly used , not only for the dative , but for any case in the plural , e . g . sleisnibh ( iv . 287 ) , as nominative plural , speuraibh ,
as gen . plr . ( Dàin 9 ) , and there occur forms like leapannan aitreabhnean , druimnean , lachainnean , aghaidnean , garraidhnean ,
etc . Urram he writes as a feminine , as in Irish , not masculine as in Scottish Gaelic .

Not much can be gathered from MacLachlan ’ s MSS . as to his dialect , but some of his spellings are interesting , e . g . , greònach ( v . 399 greadhnach ) , treodh ( treabh ,
ii . 1081 ) , snaoidh for snaidh ( passim ) ; feur - saoibh for - saidh .

He writes tu for thu in some places , pointing to the pronunciation du , e . g . , tuigidh tu ( iv . 670 ) , seall tu ( v . 1345 ) . He also writes thàinig tu ( iii , 753 and 809 ) , which points to his pronunciation a ha : na du , i . e . , thànadh thu ,
which is common colloquially . It is to be noted that he writes cleideagan and cleideach and éidi ( v . 950 and 1596 ) where the dictionary spelling is cleiteach and éitigh .

He has an etymologising spelling in mor - fhoich for mormhaich and mòr - fhear ,
and perhaps also in àroich ( iv . 875 ) .

In MS . A MacLachlan uses the spiritus asper to mark aspiration of l m n and r , but as he puts this mark in mechanically , just under those conditions where h is used for other consonants , it does not serve to indicate his pronunciation in any way . He does not mark consistently , and puts it in with consonant groups like sg , which do not aspirate , e . g . , sgaoil to mark that it is preterite . It seemed that no useful purpose could be served by retaining it , and it is not therefore printed .

It is , however , of interest to find the liquid svarabhakti vowel marked in some words of more than one syallable , or where it is developed between the elements of a compound , e . g . , ain ’ gheam ( v . 337 ) , iom ’ chrith ( v . 27 ) , coil ’ chan ( v . 213 ) , gair ’ sinn ( v . 883 ) ( not gairisinn ,

as in the dictionaries ) , con ’ chuirt ( v . 884 ) , fal ’ chas ( v . 1428 ) , an t - aon ’ bhoirionnach ( p . 1 Suim . ) , an ’ barrach ,
( ibid ) mor ’ fhoich ii . 824 , ull ’ mhaich ii . 706 , eir ’ gheadh ,
( Dàin , p . 208 ) ( which implies shortening of the vowel ) , aithn ’ idh ,
i . 334 ( i . e . , ana : i ) , and many others . It may be noted that in the single occurrence of morair the mark of the parasitic vowel is not present .

brà ,
ii . 772 — “ conflagration . ”
coimh - earsp ,
Dàin , p . 237 , i . e . , comh - eirbse ,
“ wrangling . ”
conchuirt ,
iii . 50 — “ a pack of dogs , hounds . ” Cf . Irish , conairt .
faoidhleas is used of the flash of the eyes , i . 353 , of flame , ii . 848 , of the gleam from steel , iv . 940 ; of the dawn , viii . 3 , of wine Dàin , p . 245 .
fusgais ,
v . 903 , v . 1365 , “ strength . ” This word is used in common speech in East Inverness - shire , e . g . , cha ’ n ’ eil fusgach ( d ) agam ,
I have no strength .
fàilteum ,
iv . 684 , and neo - fhàilteumach ,
Dàin , p . 243 . Apparently fàilteum means wrong , and neo - fhàilteumach ,
harmless .
rati ,
cf . vocabulary to Sàr - obair , where the word is given as slang for whiskey .
ruth - bhalg ,
iv . 555 , iv . 660 , Dàin , p . 237 . “ strength , ” “ power . ”
seanghall ,
vi . 141 , “ herald , ” ? cf . seneschal .
sgaidhm ,
iv . 925 , i . e . , sgaoim .
sgeum ,
iii . 293 , scheme .
slinntrich ,
ii . 394 , iii . 596 , iv . 796 , v . 79 , “ sound ” ( verb and noun ) .
snisnich ,
iv . 469 , v . 353 , “ give way before . ”
stataint ,
iv . 501 ( if such is the reading ) .
tunnta ,
ii . 1544 , apparently “ abundant . ”

In one passage , ii 1534 , Aonghas for Aeneas , is written , whether by oversight or intentionally is not clear . Here and there he has a note where he thinks he sees an etymological connection between the Greek name and the Gaelic translation , e . g . , [Greugais] he translates leug - uilionnach ,
and notes on it leug - oileannach .
The Skaean Gates are Dorsain nan Sgiath , [Greugais] is craobh comhraig .
Thersites he suggests is Conan ( [Greugais] ) . He does not , however , employ the Gaelic proper name Eachainn but writes Hector . At v . 275 = Iliad E 145 , the MS . reads Hipenor ,
the Greek Hypeiron . [Greugais] ( i . 159 ) he suggests is a shùil - mhadatidh , a bhalgaire bheadaidh .

Beag an tùs i ; ’ s luath a fàs ,
An Tarmusg nach ailli greann ,
’ S uaimhreach air talamh a triall ,
’ S àrd a measg nan niall a ceann !
— ( ibid , p . 159 ) .

Aithris , a bhan - dia nam fonn !
Fearg mhic Pheleuis nan glonn àigh ,
Fearg mhìllteach a chiùrr a ’ Ghréig
Le beud nan deich mìle cràdh .
— Duan i . 1 - 4 .

Line 5 do ’ n uaigh romh ’ n am
Anmannan dheich mìltean sonn
An cuirp aig àr - choin an fhuinn
’ S aig ianlaith nan speur ’ nam pronn
88 Omitted in An Gaidheal .
159 Cha ’ n iomair ceann - toisich nam feachd
198 Lines 198 and 199 are placed after line 201
205 Reubar mi , dh ’ aindeoin sin
311 ’ S pailt ás d ’ aonais laoich ri m ’ thaobh
A ’ s coisnear leam caoin tì nan speur
393 Sin cha d ’ fhàg
406 - 408 Omitted in An Gaidheal .
540 Bhriséis .
636 ’ S gu ’ n co - phàirtich mi
693 Cobhair - s ’ orm
699 Mar chath thu ’ n aobhar an dé
Dh ’ oghlaicheas
703 & 720 slabhraidhean .
818 Gu m ’ chobhair
829 Lean a ghàirdnean
( Obviously a misreading of the text ) .
874 Bha uchd na cainbe sùchte , cruinn

Line 40 Cian - chaidreamh an cadal leisg
65 Osna ’ s teinn , a ’ s blàr , a ’ s eug
117 Gabh gu mion - bheachdaidh
133 laochraidh
145 mannta mìn
156 fo ’ n arma cruaidh
199 ’ S bho Phélops thainig i nios
368 dìobhag
491 omitted in An Gaidheal . The Nat . Lib . MS . contains it .
903 ’ s an duibh gur léir
